column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#Text=Hydrogenolysis of Poly(DTBn-Adipate)
#Text=Preparation
#Text=In a 500 mL pressure bottle was placed 21 g of poly(DTBn-adipate) having a M.sub.w of 76.8 Kda and M.sub.n of 43.7 Kda.
#Text=To the bottle was then added 200 mL of DMF and the mixture was stirred until a clear solution was obtained.
#Text=To this solution were added 4 g of 5% Pd on BaSO.sub.4 catalyst.
#Text=The pressure bottle was attached to the Parr hydrogenator and the air inside the bottle was displaced with hydrogen by alternatively pressurizing with hydrogen and then depressurizing.
#Text=The bottle was maintained at a hydrogen pressure of 60 psi and then subjected to shaking for 24 h.
#Text=An aliquot was withdrawn and after suitable treatment examined by .sup.1 H NMR which showed complete removal of the benzyl group.
#Text=The reaction was stopped and the reaction mixture was centrifuged.
#Text=The supernatant was filtered using a celite bed on a sintered glass funnel.
#Text=The filtrate was added to 2.0 L of cooled deionized water in a high speed blender.
#Text=The precipitated product was isolated by filtration and washed with 2.0 L of water.
#Text=The product was dried in a stream of nitrogen for 16 h and then dried in vacuum oven at room temperature for 2 days.
#Text=Structure Proof

#Text=The .sup.1 H NMR spectrum of the product in DMSO-d.sub.6 showed the following resonances (.delta., ppm relative to TMS): 8.26 (br s, 0.95H, NH), 7.00-7.09 (m, 8H, aromatic H's), 4.71 (m, 1H, CH of tyrosine), 2.2-3.3 (m, 10H, CH.sub.2 's of DAT, Tyrosine and CH.sub.1 --CO--), 1.74 (t, 4H, CH.sub.2 --CH.sub.2 of adipate).
#Text=Also, a multiplet that is found in poly(DTBn-adipate) at 5.1 due to benzyl H's was completely absent, indicating complete removal of the benzyl protecting groups.
#Text=Also, the amide NH peaks had shifted from 8.45 ppm in poly(DTBn-adipate) to 8.26 ppm.
#Text=The phenyl resonance of the benzyl group at 7.35 ppm was also absent in the product.
#Text=No other significant changes in the spectrum were observed.
